app package¶

Submodules¶

app.auth module¶

class app.auth.Customer¶

Bases: TypedDict

Represents a customer in the system.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Full name of the customer.

  • username (str) – Unique username of the customer.

  • age (int) – Age of the customer.

  • address (str) – Address of the customer.

  • gender (bool) – Gender of the customer (True for male, False for female).

  • marital_status (str) – Marital status of the customer (e.g., single, married).

  • role (str) – Role of the customer (e.g., customer, admin).

address: str¶
age: int¶
gender: bool¶
marital_status: str¶
name: str¶
role: str¶
username: str¶
app.auth.create_access_token(customer: Customer, expires_delta: timedelta = datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600)) → str¶

Create a JWT token for a Customer.

Parameters:

  • customer (Customer) – The customer object for which to create the token.

  • expires_delta (timedelta) – The token expiry duration (default is 1 hour).

Returns:

A JWT token as a string.

Return type:

str

app.auth.decode_access_token(token: str) → dict | str¶

Decode and verify a JWT token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token to decode.

Returns:

The payload as a dictionary if valid, or an error message if invalid.

Return type:

Union[dict, str]

app.auth.get_current_user(authorization: str = Header(None)) → dict¶

Decode and verify the current user from the JWT token in the Authorization header.

Parameters:

authorization (str) – The Authorization header containing the Bearer token.

Returns:

Decoded payload with user information.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is missing, invalid, or expired.

async app.main.login(credentials: LoginRequest)¶

Authenticates a user and generates a JWT token.

Parameters:

credentials (LoginRequest) – The login credentials (username and password).

Returns:

A response containing the JWT token if login is successful.

Return type:

BaseCustomResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the username or password is invalid or if an error occurs.

async app.main.moderate(customer_id: str, item_id: int, new_flag: Literal['flagged', 'approved', 'needs_approval'], credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer))¶

Moderates a review by updating its flagged status.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer who submitted the review.

  • item_id (int) – The ID of the item being reviewed.

  • new_flag (Literal["flagged", "approved", "needs_approval"]) – The new flag status for the review. Must be one of [“flagged”, “approved”, “needs_approval”].

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The authentication credentials of the moderator.

Returns:

A response indicating the success or failure of the moderation operation.

Return type:

ModerateReviewsResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not have the necessary permissions or if an error occurs.

Bases: object

Handles database operations for managing reviews.

Attributes:

client (Client): The Supabase client for database operations. table (SyncRequestBuilder): The reviews table for database queries.

Verifies if the customer and item exist in the database.

  • item_id (int) – The ID of the item to check.

Returns:

app.schemas module¶

class app.schemas.BaseCustomResponse(status_code: int, message: str, data: Any | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: JSONResponse

Base response class for standardizing API responses.

Attributes:

status_code (int): The HTTP status code of the response. message (str): A descriptive message about the response. data (Optional[Any]): The payload data for the response. notes (Optional[str]): Additional notes for the response. errors (Optional[str]): Any errors related to the response.

class app.schemas.DeleteReviewResponse(status_code: int, item_id: int, customer_id: str, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseCustomResponse

Response schema for deleting a review.

Attributes:

item_id (int): The ID of the item being reviewed. customer_id (str): The ID of the customer whose review is being deleted.

class app.schemas.GetReviewsResponse(status_code: int, item_id: int | None = None, customer_id: str | None = None, reviews: list[Review] | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseCustomResponse

Response schema for retrieving reviews.

Attributes:

item_id (Optional[int]): The ID of the item being reviewed, if applicable. customer_id (Optional[str]): The ID of the customer whose reviews are retrieved, if applicable. reviews (Optional[list[Review]]): A list of retrieved reviews.

class app.schemas.ModerateReviewsResponse(status_code: int, item_id: int, customer_id: str, new_flag: str, review: Review | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseCustomResponse

Response for moderating customer reviews.

Attributes:

status_code (int): The HTTP status code of the response. item_id (int): The ID of the item being reviewed. customer_id (str): The ID of the customer whose review is being moderated. new_flag (str): The new moderation status for the review. review (Optional[Review]): The updated review object, if moderation is successful. notes (Optional[str]): Additional notes related to the response. errors (Optional[str]): Error details, if any.

Attributes:

class app.schemas.Review(*, customer_id: str, item_id: int, rating: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=5)], comment: str, time: str | None = None, flagged: Literal['flagged', 'approved', 'needs_approval'])¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a review submitted by a customer.

Attributes:

customer_id (str): The ID of the customer submitting the review. item_id (int): The ID of the item being reviewed. rating (int): The rating given by the customer, must be between 0 and 5. comment (str): The text comment provided by the customer. time (Optional[str]): The timestamp of when the review was submitted. flagged (Literal[“flagged”, “approved”, “needs_approval”]): The moderation status of the review.
